author: John Morrison
title: Best James Brown Songs: 20 Funk And Soul Masterpieces
text:
Best James Brown Songs: 20 Funk And Soul Masterpieces
This introduction to The Godfather of Soul contains some of the most important music of the 20th century.
If one were to name
James Brown as one of the most influential artists of the 20th century and beyond, there are few reasonable people who would argue. Born in 1933 in Barnwell, South Carolina, and raised in Augusta, Georgia, Brown grew up singing in gospel quartets and performing throughout the South. When he joined The Famous Flames, a powerful rhythm and blues ensemble fronted by his friend Bobby Byrd, Brown‚Äôs journey to stardom would begin.
An electric performer and tireless innovator, Brown‚Äôs catalog is one of the most diverse in the history of recorded music. From his emotive ballads in the 1950s, the fiery R&B sides of the 60s, the deeply funky and socially conscious workouts of the 70s, or his pop-soul hits of the 1980s, James Brown didn‚Äôt just weather the stylistic changes that shaped popular music. Most of the time, he was a major initiator of those changes.
Listen to the best James Brown songs on
Apple Music or Spotify.
When the cultural revolution of hip-hop exploded onto mainstream consciousness in the 80s, sampling arose as a new and radical musical innovation. Hungry for hypnotic grooves, pounding drum breaks, dynamic vocals, and horn riffs, hip-hop producers and DJs naturally gravitated to the Godfather of Soul. Since then, countless DJs and producers have taken bits of James Brown‚Äôs best songs to use in their own new creations, thus allowing Brown‚Äôs musical DNA to continue to spread far and wide.
With dozens of studio albums, live albums, and compilations as well as the numerous hits that Brown produced for associated acts like
Lyn Collins, The J.B.s, Vicki Anderson, Bobby Byrd, and others, there is no list that could fully encompass James Brown‚Äôs prodigious musical output. That being said, these 20 best songs are a great introduction to his incredible career.
The ballads
(Try Me; Please, Please, Please; Bewildered; I Love You, Yes I Do)
Rooted in the traditions of gospel and blues, one of the greatest weapons James Brown‚Äôs arsenal is his ability to pour deep emotion into a soulful ballad. While some of his best songs like ‚ÄúTry Me‚Äù and ‚ÄúPlease, Please, Please‚Äù were hits and undeniable classics, Brown brought that same ecstatic energy to ballads like ‚ÄúBewildered‚Äù and ‚ÄúI Love You, Yes I Do.‚Äù With his strained, gravely voice, Brown was able to add a rough edge and sense of pleading urgency to these songs, a balladeer who could blur the lines between pain and pleasure, love and loss.
The origins of funk
(I Got You (I Feel Good); Papa‚Äôs Got A Brand New Bag; I Got The Feelin‚Äô; Cold Sweat; Superbad Pt. 1&2; Ain‚Äôt It Funky Now; Get Up (I Feel Like Being a) Sex Machine; Get Up Offa That Thang)
For James Brown, the mid-to-late 60s were an incredibly prolific and innovative period. Not only did Brown produce several of his best songs in this period with cuts like ‚ÄúI Got You (I Feel Good),‚Äù ‚ÄúPapa‚Äôs Got A Brand New Bag,‚Äù ‚ÄúI Got The Feelin‚Äô,‚Äù he would ultimately change the course of music history by introducing a new rhythmic concept and compositional matrix into the fold. With 1967‚Äôs ‚ÄúCold Sweat,‚Äù Brown placed heavy emphasis on the first beat of a song‚Äôs measure and repurposed melodic instruments into agents of rhythm. With this set of daring innovations, what we know today as funk was born. Whether it as the driving, hypnotic grooves of ‚ÄúSuperbad Pt. 1&2‚Äù and ‚ÄúAin‚Äôt It Funky Now‚Äù or flamboyant anthems like ‚ÄúGet Up (I Feel Like Being a) Sex Machine‚Äù and ‚ÄúGet Up Offa That Thang,‚Äù Brown would consistently prove that he was not only the inventor of the funk, but its chief innovator.
James Brown songs with a message
(Say It Loud ‚Äì I‚Äôm Black and I‚Äôm Proud; It‚Äôs a Man‚Äôs Man‚Äôs World; The Payback)
As fate would have it, the peak of James Brown‚Äôs popularity, as well as his creative prime, would coincide with (and in many ways inspire) both the Civil Rights era and the Black Power Movement. As with many of the United States‚Äô great musicians, Brown also sought to express the frustrations and hopes of the people by injecting socially conscious messages into his music. ‚ÄúSay It Loud ‚Äì I‚Äôm Black and I‚Äôm Proud‚Äù emphasized Black pride in a white-dominated world, while ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a Man‚Äôs Man‚Äôs World‚Äù celebrated the contributions of women. Oftentimes, Brown would just rap to the brothers and sisters on the street with cuts like ‚ÄúThe Payback,‚Äù lending his voice to articulate the Black, working-class experience.
Hip-hop‚Äôs DNA
(Funky Drummer; Give It Up or Turn It Loose; Blues And Pants; Mind Power; Papa Don‚Äôt Take No Mess)
When hip-hop first emerged in the early 70s, DJs utilized
the funky grooves and pounding drum breaks of James Brown and the legions of bands that his best songs inspired. As sampling technology evolved, producers would once again turn to Brown, extracting snippets of horn riffs, basslines, screams, guitar licks, and drums to build entirely new collages of sound. The hypnotic, extended grooves of ‚ÄúGive It Up or Turn it Loose,‚Äù ‚ÄúBlues And Pants,‚Äù ‚ÄúMind Power,‚Äù and ‚ÄúPapa Don‚Äôt Take No Mess‚Äù have all been sampled famously. ‚ÄúFunky Drummer,‚Äù however, is perhaps Brown‚Äôs greatest contribution to sampling culture. Showing up in hundreds if not thousands of songs, ‚ÄúFunky Drummer‚Äù has helped to shape the future of music to this day.
Think we missed one of the best James Brown songs? Let us know in the comments below.
11 Comments
-
Hot Pants and Soul Power need to be SOMEWHERE!
-
How about Mother Popcorn?
-
1. There was a Time
2. Make it Funky
3. There it Is
4. Talking Loud
-
There was a time. There it Is, Talking Loud, Make it Funky.
-
I would add an early cover of the standard Night Train, Doing it to Death, and the lessor played masterpiece It‚Äôs too Funky in Here.
-
Body Heat
-
Get On The Good Foot is a #1 groove jam. King Heroin is a serious message song.
-
Funky President, stays relevant!
You could always play both sides of James‚Äôs 45s, so could you ever say James had an, ‚ÄòA & B side‚Äô?
-
Doing It To Death has to be in there somewhere, fantastic song.
-
‚ÄúI‚Äôll Go Crazy‚Äù and ‚ÄúMaybe The Last Time‚Äù need to be in ‚ÄúThe ballads‚Äù
For ‚ÄúThe origins of funk‚Äù category, I can‚Äôt miss those below:
Good Good Lovin‚Äô
Think
Tell Me What You‚Äôre Gonna Do
I Don‚Äôt Want Nobody To Give Me Nothing (Open Up The Door I‚Äôll Get It Myself)
Mother Popcorn
It‚Äôs A New Day
I‚Äôm A Greedy Man
Get On The Good Foot
I Got A Bag Of My Own
I would add few more groovy mid-tempo songs such as ‚ÄúI Can‚Äôt Stand Myself (When You Touch Me)‚Äù, ‚ÄúThere Was A Time‚Äù, ‚ÄúSoul Power‚Äù and ‚ÄúDoing It To Death‚Äù.
-
Ain‚Äôt It Funky Now

author: Amy Curtis
title: Despicable UCLA Appeals to Ninth Circuit So They Can Allow Antisemitism on Campus This Fall
text: [Yesterday, we told you](https://twitchy.com/amy-curtis/2024/08/14/judge-blocks-ucla-from-allowing-antisemitic-goons-to-block-jews-on-campous-n2399618) a federal judge blocked UCLA from assisting or allowing antisemitic bigots to harass and discriminate against Jewish students. This is the correct ruling. UCLA administrators allowed the pro-Hamas goons to give their [allies armbands to access buildings, and to bar anyone](https://twitchy.com/amy-curtis/2024/05/01/ucla-wristbands-for-anti-israel-students-to-enter-buildings-n2395761) -- mostly Jews -- who didn't have them. This is a direct violation of Title VI of federal civil rights law. UCLA appealed that ruling today. Breaking: UCLA has filed an appeal to the 9th Circuit challenging the injunction which ruled that the university could not allow the discrimination and exclusion of Jewish students on UCLA campus.‚Äî Eyal Yakoby (@EYakoby) UCLA continues to prove that they‚Äôre antisemitism is a systemic problem. [pic.twitter.com/2HliPFsqMy] [August 15, 2024] There is no other way to interpret this than the administration of UCLA condones antisemitism and discrimination against Jewish students. It is beyond despicable. They‚Äôre going to lose again.‚Äî The Flag Guy (@TheFlagGuy_) They‚Äôre always losers. [August 15, 2024] Yeah, they'll lose. But the fact they decided to appeal this decision speaks volumes about them. This is shocking behavior from a school with significant Jewish alumni.‚Äî Seth J. RiklinüéóÔ∏è‚òÆÔ∏èüá∫üá∏ü§†üáÆüá±üõ© (@sethriklin) [August 15, 2024] Their hatred of Jews doesn't seem to extend to endowments, apparently. Here's proof that‚Äî David Wohl (@DavidWohl) [@UCLA]wants to continue its campaign of hate, harassment and intimidation against Jewish students. If this school is not shut down immediately by the feds, it will be when Trump reassumes office. [August 15, 2024] Recommended It will be an interesting case study to see what schools, if any, face consequences for blatantly violating federal civil rights laws. Jews should find a new university system to go to. These folks have lost their minds‚Äî Johnny Riggs üêä (@JohnnyRiggs9) [August 15, 2024] On one hand, we understand this thinking. Go where they won't discriminate against you. On the other hand, they have a right to be there and should fight to remove the systemic rot from UCLA and every other institution. UCLA really, really wants to discriminate‚Äî Nicole Levitt (@LevittNicole7) [https://t.co/vqadsOiNoQ] [August 15, 2024] YUP. They want to enable the pro-Hamas loons to do the dirty work for them. UCLA is adamant that anti-discrimination laws must not apply to Jews. Gavin Newsom is the head of the UC system and could stop UCLA from pursuing its anti-Semitic agenda. But he wants to be president someday and the Democrat Party does not tolerate opposition to Jew hatred.‚Äî Ayn Reagan (@AynReagan) [https://t.co/69WW5yEIIK] [August 15, 2024] There's a reason Kamala chose [Walz over Shapiro](https://twitchy.com/samj/2024/08/06/breaking-kamalas-vp-pick-is-n2399296) for her running mate. Seriously? UCLA is appealing this ruling? Maybe they should change their name from UCLA to hitler U.‚Äî Larree (@larreehollywood) [https://t.co/BRORwlE7DH] [August 15, 2024] Would be more fitting. Seriously, remember this when the Left accuses the right of being Nazis. Laugh in their faces. The real question remains, why hasn't the DoJ come in and shut down UCLA? Where is the‚Äî Yore Friend Whig üáÆüá± (@WhigJust) [@CivilRights]Division? Do Jews not count? [https://t.co/Sg7KrruaAh] [August 15, 2024] Because Jews don't count. This writer will lay down the marker now: the DOJ will be much harder on schools that violate the new Title IX rules than they'll be on any college that allows discrimination against Jews.

author: Syndicated Content
title: DeMar DeRozan helps Bulls outlast Scottie Barnes, Raptors
text:
DeMar DeRozan had 24 points, seven rebounds and six assists and the visiting Chicago Bulls defeated the Toronto Raptors 116-110 Thursday night.
Nikola Vucevic added 24 points, 14 rebounds and seven assists for the Bulls. Coby White had 23 points and eight rebounds, Patrick Williams added 12 points and Alex Caruso and Ayo Dosunmu each scored 10.
Scottie Barnes finished with 31 points, seven rebounds and six assists and RJ Barrett added 17 points and six assists for the Raptors, who are 1-1 in their first two games since trading Pascal Siakam to the Indiana Pacers on Wednesday.
Bruce Brown, who came to Toronto in that trade, scored 15 points in his Raptors debut. Immanuel Quickley scored 12 points and Jontay Porter had 10.
Chicago‚Äôs Zach LaVine left the game early in the third quarter and went to the locker room with an apparent ankle injury. He returned to the bench a few minutes later. He had eight points.
Chicago took a four-point lead into the fourth quarter.
Barrett‚Äôs dunk gave Toronto a one-point lead with 8:54 left in the fourth. The lead changed hands throughout the period until White‚Äôs jumper gave Chicago a 110-109 lead with 2:08 to play. DeRozan added an 11-footer and made two free throws give Chicago a four-point lead with 55 seconds remaining. White‚Äôs jumper bumped the final margin to six.
The Bulls outshot the Raptors 52.7 percent to 50.6 percent from the floor despite making only 6 of 24 3-pointers on the night.
Chicago led 38-27 after the first quarter.
Brown scored his first two points with his new team with 8:31 left in the second quarter to cut Chicago‚Äôs lead to four. Toronto tied the game at 50 on Thaddeus Young‚Äôs dunk with 4:18 remaining.
Barrett‚Äôs 3-pointer gave Toronto a 58-57 lead with 1:37 to play in the first half, but the Bulls scored the next six points to lead by five at halftime.
The Bulls led by 12 points after White‚Äôs layup with 4:14 left in the third quarter. Barnes rolled in a layup to trim the margin to 90-86 after three quarters.
Jakob Poeltl (ankle) did not play for Toronto.
‚ÄìField Level Media

author: TBN News Coordinator ‚Äì JB
title: Detectives Apprehend Five Suspects Linked To Armed Robberies Orchestrated via Social Media
text:
Jerrell Maurice Grey, Justin Amari Banks, and Darius Lerenzo Mearis WALDORF, Md. ‚Äì On April 22, detectives assigned to the Criminal Investigations Division Robbery Unit arrested five suspects, ages 17 to 21, who were identified as suspects in several armed robberies that go back to April 9, 2024.
In these cases, the suspects used a fake profile of a female on a social media dating app. People who responded to the profile were given directions to meet in the area of Amberleaf Place. When they arrived, the suspects robbed them at gunpoint, physically assaulted them, and stole money. The profile of the female changed in each case.
As a result of the investigation, detectives identified the suspects and served search warrants at six residences, recovering four handguns and evidence linking them to the robberies. Several of the suspects were arrested during the search warrants; however, one of the suspects, age 17, was arrested on his way to school at St. Charles High School. During that arrest, officers located a loaded privately made handgun ‚Äì commonly known as a ‚Äúghost gun‚Äù ‚Äì with an extended 30-round magazine concealed in the suspect‚Äôs pants.
The suspects have been identified as Darius Lerenzo Mearis, 21, of White Plains; Justin Amari Banks, 18, of Waldorf; Jerrell Maurice Grey, 20, of Waldorf, and two 17-year-old males from Waldorf (charged as adults). All of the suspects were charged with robbery, first-degree assault, second-degree assault, illegal possession of a firearm, and other related charges. The suspects are currently being held without bond at the Charles County Detention Center.
Anyone with information is asked to call Detective Thayer at 301-609-6484. Tipsters who want to remain anonymous may contact Charles County Crime Solvers by calling 1-866-411-TIPS. Tips can also be submitted online at www.charlescountycrimesolvers.com or by using the P3Intel mobile app. The investigation is ongoing.
The CCSO was accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Agencies, Inc. (CALEA) in 2001 and has since earned the highest rating of Excellence. Established in 1658, the CCSO is one of the oldest law enforcement agencies in the United States. For more information, visit www.ccso.us .
Charles County Crime Solvers offers rewards of up to $1,000 for information that leads to the arrest or indictment of a person responsible for a crime in Charles County. All individuals who provide tips through Crime Solvers will remain anonymous. Anyone with information about an unsolved crime or the location of a fugitive may contact Charles County Crime Solvers by calling 1-866-411-TIPS. Tips can also be submitted online at www.charlescountycrimesolvers.com or by using the P3Intel mobile app, which can be found in the Android Store and Apple Store by searching P3tips. For more information about the P3 program, click on this link: www.p3intel.com.

author: @infobae
title: Paneles solares, una iniciativa para ayudar a las familias mexicanas a reducir costos - Infobae
text:
La energ√≠a solar fotovoltaica evita la emisi√≥n de 3,534 toneladas de CO2 anuales, seg√∫n datos oficiales de SENER. (GOBIERNO DE CANARIAS) El Gobierno de M√©xico, a trav√©s de la Secretar√≠a de Energ√≠a (SENER) y en colaboraci√≥n con el Fideicomiso para el Ahorro de Energ√≠a El√©ctrica (FIDE), ha implementado un programa que busca facilitar la instalaci√≥n de sistemas fotovoltaicos en hogares mexicanos.
Seg√∫n inform√≥ el sitio oficial de SENER y FIDE, este proyecto est√° dirigido a familias que enfrentan altos costos en sus recibos de electricidad , espec√≠ficamente aquellas que pagan m√°s de $1,500 pesos mensuales. El objetivo principal es reducir el gasto energ√©tico de los hogares y fomentar el uso de energ√≠as renovables .
El programa ofrece un esquema de apoyo financiero que combina un subsidio directo y un cr√©dito con condiciones preferenciales. De acuerdo con la informaci√≥n publicada, la SENER otorga un incentivo equivalente al 25% del costo total del proyecto, mientras que el 75% restante es financiado por el FIDE a trav√©s de un cr√©dito con una tasa de inter√©s preferencial y un plazo de pago de hasta cinco a√±os .
Un programa que busca generar energ√≠a y reducir emisiones
Las personas que rentan viviendas pueden obtener paneles solares si cumplen con requisitos, incluyendo autorizaci√≥n del propietario y un aval solidario. (REUTERS/Amit Dave/File Photo) Seg√∫n los datos proporcionados por la SENER, hasta el momento se han realizado 1,206 proyectos de instalaci√≥n de sistemas fotovoltaicos en hogares y una de las ventajas destacadas es que estos sistemas tienen una capacidad instalada total de 5 mil 102 kilovatios pico (kWp), lo que permite generar aproximadamente 7 millones 906 mil 680 kilovatios hora (kWh) al a√±o.
Adem√°s, esta iniciativa contribuye significativamente a la reducci√≥n de emisiones de di√≥xido de carbono , ya que, seg√∫n su sitio oficial, evita la emisi√≥n de 3.534 toneladas de CO2 al a√±o.
Seg√∫n detall√≥ la SENER, incluso las personas que rentan una vivienda pueden acceder al beneficio , siempre y cuando cumplan con ciertos requisitos. Entre estos se encuentran presentar una copia del contrato de arrendamiento, contar con la autorizaci√≥n expresa del propietario para la instalaci√≥n del sistema y disponer de un aval solidario con propiedad libre de gravamen.
Por otro lado, aquellos que actualmente tienen un bajo consumo de electricidad , pero planean adquirir equipos de alto consumo, tambi√©n pueden participar. En estos casos, se realiza una evaluaci√≥n del sistema fotovoltaico considerando la futura ampliaci√≥n de la carga el√©ctrica.
Asimismo, las personas que habitan en viviendas nuevas , donde a√∫n no se registra un consumo significativo de energ√≠a, pueden acceder al programa mediante la elaboraci√≥n de un cuadro de cargas que permita determinar la capacidad del sistema necesario y para acceder al programa, los interesados deben presentar una serie de documentos iniciales.
Seg√∫n inform√≥ la SENER, estos incluyen una solicitud de cr√©dito firmada, una carta de consulta al Bur√≥ de Cr√©dito, una copia del recibo de electricidad con una antig√ºedad no mayor a dos meses, una copia de una identificaci√≥n oficial (como credencial de elector, pasaporte o FM2 para extranjeros), una copia del Registro Federal de Contribuyentes (RFC) y un comprobante de situaci√≥n fiscal actualizado .
Energ√≠a fotovoltaica y su impacto en el medioambiente
La orientaci√≥n arquitect√≥nica y el dise√±o sostenible maximizan la eficiencia energ√©tica de la energ√≠a solar pasiva en edificios. (REUTERS/Luisa Gonzalez) Seg√∫n inform√≥ Selectra, un portal especializado en sostenibilidad, esta forma de obtener energ√≠a se ha convertido en una opci√≥n clave para avanzar hacia un desarrollo sostenible y de acuerdo con la misma fuente, la energ√≠a solar se clasifica en tres tipos principales: fotovoltaica, t√©rmica y pasiva. Cada una de estas modalidades tiene caracter√≠sticas espec√≠ficas que determinan su funcionamiento y aplicaciones.
La energ√≠a solar fotovoltaica, por ejemplo, utiliza paneles solares para convertir la radiaci√≥n solar en electricidad mediante el efecto fotovoltaico. Por otro lado, la energ√≠a solar t√©rmica se centra en la captaci√≥n del calor del sol para calentar agua o generar vapor, mientras que la energ√≠a solar pasiva se basa en el dise√±o arquitect√≥nico para aprovechar la luz y el calor solar sin necesidad de dispositivos mec√°nicos.
Seg√∫n detall√≥ Selectra, su funcionamiento se basa en el uso de paneles solares compuestos por c√©lulas fotovoltaicas que transforman la radiaci√≥n solar en electricidad. Esta tecnolog√≠a es ampliamente utilizada tanto en instalaciones residenciales como en grandes plantas solares y su popularidad ha crecido significativamente debido a la reducci√≥n de costos en los √∫ltimos a√±os.
Entre sus principales aplicaciones se encuentran el autoconsumo energ√©tico en viviendas y empresas, as√≠ como la generaci√≥n de electricidad a gran escala para abastecer redes el√©ctricas. Adem√°s, esta tecnolog√≠a permite la instalaci√≥n de sistemas aislados en zonas remotas donde no llega la red el√©ctrica, lo que contribuye a la electrificaci√≥n de comunidades rurales.
Otra modalidad destacada es la energ√≠a solar t√©rmica, que se utiliza principalmente para calentar agua o generar vapor mediante colectores solares. Seg√∫n explic√≥ Selectra, este tipo de energ√≠a es com√∫n en sistemas de calefacci√≥n, climatizaci√≥n de piscinas y procesos industriales que requieren altas temperaturas.
Los sistemas solares t√©rmicos suelen ser m√°s eficientes en t√©rminos de aprovechamiento energ√©tico que los fotovoltaicos, ya que convierten directamente la radiaci√≥n solar en calor. Sin embargo, su implementaci√≥n depende de factores como la ubicaci√≥n geogr√°fica y las necesidades espec√≠ficas de cada usuario.
La energ√≠a solar pasiva, aunque menos conocida, juega un papel importante en el dise√±o sostenible de edificios . Seg√∫n inform√≥ Selectra, esta modalidad no requiere dispositivos mec√°nicos, sino que se basa en el dise√±o arquitect√≥nico para maximizar el aprovechamiento de la luz y el calor solar .
Entre las estrategias utilizadas se encuentran la orientaci√≥n adecuada de las edificaciones, el uso de materiales que retienen el calor y la incorporaci√≥n de ventanas y tragaluces para optimizar la iluminaci√≥n natural . Este enfoque no solo reduce el consumo energ√©tico, sino que tambi√©n mejora el confort t√©rmico en los espacios interiores.
Seg√∫n destac√≥ Selectra, entre las principales ventajas se encuentran su car√°cter renovable e inagotable , la reducci√≥n de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero y la disminuci√≥n de la dependencia de combustibles f√≥siles. Adem√°s, su implementaci√≥n puede generar ahorros econ√≥micos a largo plazo , especialmente en sistemas de autoconsumo.
Sin embargo, enfrenta limitaciones como la intermitencia de la radiaci√≥n solar, que depende de factores clim√°ticos y horarios , as√≠ como de la necesidad de sistemas de almacenamiento energ√©tico para garantizar un suministro constante. Asimismo, los costos iniciales de instalaci√≥n pueden ser elevados, aunque los apoyos en muchos pa√≠ses han reducido esta barrera.

author: editorial@pulzo.com (Editorial Pulzo)
title: Wilmar Rold√°n super√≥ a √ì. Ruiz y rompi√≥ r√©cord en Eliminatorias; puede seguir de largo
text: [Felipe Galindo](/autor/felipe-galindo) En el dif√≠cil reto del estadio municipal de El Alto, ubicado a 4.150 metros sobre el nivel del mar en el departamento de La Paz (Bolivia), [Wilmar Roldan](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/wilmar-roldan) se convirti√≥ en el juez con m√°s partidos dirigidos en las Eliminatorias. (Vea tambi√©n: [Por qu√© no se consiguen boletas para partidos de Colombia; revendedor revel√≥ qu√© hay detr√°s](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/boletas-para-colombia-vs-argentina-por-que-no-consiguen-precio-reventa-PP3917265)) Tal y como comparti√≥ el periodista Jos√© Orlando Ascencio, de El Tiempo, el √°rbitro antioque√±o lleg√≥ a 20 partidos con el duelo Bolivia-Venezuela y super√≥ el r√©cord de 15 a√±os que ten√≠a su compatriota √ìscar Juli√°n Ruiz. Rold√°n, de 44 a√±os de edad, se ubica ahora en el primer lugar de ese prestigioso escalaf√≥n superando a Ruiz, ya retirado, que es segundo con 19 encuentros. El argentino H√©ctor Baldassi es tercero con 18 juegos dirigidos. El colombiano puede seguir de largo con el registro, pues a√∫n le quedan algunos a√±os de carrera. Cu√°les son los √°rbitros con m√°s partidos dirigidos en la Eliminatorias Esta es la lista de los √°rbitros con m√°s juegos dirigidos en las [ Eliminatorias](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/eliminatorias-sudamericanas), seg√∫n informaci√≥n brindada por El Tiempo: - W√≠lmar Rold√°n (Colombia) 20. - √ìscar Juli√°n Ruiz (Colombia) 19. - H√©ctor Baldassi (Argentina) 18. - Marcio Rezende (Brasil) 17. - Horacio Elizondo (Argentina) 15. [Rold√°n no tuvo piedad y expuls√≥ a jugador de Boca a los 30 segundos; no sirvi√≥ el llanto](/deportes/roldan-expulso-advincula-boca-vs-cruzeiro-30-segundos-video-por-que-PP3883793) [Revelan audios de Wilmar Rold√°n en Chile vs. Canad√°; jugada por la que piden su suspensi√≥n](/deportes/copa-america/audios-arbitro-wilmar-roldan-chile-vs-canada-copa-america-PP3754094A) [Todo Chile se fue encima de Wilmar Rold√°n por su arbitraje en Copa Am√©rica ante Canad√°](/deportes/copa-america/wilmar-roldan-cuestionado-chile-arbitraje-copa-america-PP3753212A) [Enner Valencia fue expulsado por Wilmar Rold√°n en Copa Am√©rica; meti√≥ patada karateca](/deportes/copa-america/enner-valencia-ecuador-expulsado-por-wilmar-roldan-copa-america-video-PP3735500) Qui√©n es Wilmar Rold√°n, √°rbitro con r√©cord en Eliminatorias Wilmar Rold√°n comenz√≥ su carrera como [√°rbitro](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/arbitros) en el f√∫tbol profesional colombiano y, debido a su firmeza en el campo de juego y capacidad para tomar decisiones en poco tiempo, se fue ganando un espacio en el √°mbito internacional hasta pitar su primer encuentro de Eliminatorias el primero de abril de 2009. Desde entonces, el antioque√±o tom√≥ protagonismo, participando en Copa Libertadores, Copa Sudamericana, Eliminatorias, Mundial de Clubes e, incluso, [ la liga de Arabia Saud√≠](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/wilmar-roldan-hablo-gestos-que-le-hizo-cristiano-ronaldo-arabia-PP3336649A). LO √öLTIMO [Deportes] Hace 8 horas ["Hubo acercamientos": Sergio Higuita tuvo todo para correr con Nairo, pero negocio se cay√≥](/deportes/sergio-higuita-razon-no-llegar-movistar-junto-nairo-quintana-PP3954822) [Deportes] Hace 9 horas [¬øPor qu√© Santa Fe no busc√≥ estadio durante Mundial Sub-20 Femenino? El t√©cnico respondi√≥](/deportes/independiente-santa-fe-pablo-peirano-explico-que-no-buscaron-estadio-PP3954713A) [Deportes]

author: Aman Saxena
title: From Buffering to Breakdown: What Went Wrong with Netflix‚Äôs Tyson vs. Jake Paul Live Stream?
text: In November 2024, Netflix faced significant issues during its live stream of the highly anticipated Tyson vs. Jake Paul boxing match. Despite being a leader in on-demand video streaming, the platform‚Äôs attempt to deliver live sports proved problematic, with widespread buffering, outages, and technical glitches that left many fans frustrated. This failure came at a crucial moment, as Netflix made its first major foray into live sports streaming. In contrast, platforms like Hotstar, known for its ability to handle millions of concurrent viewers, managed their live streams with ease. What went wrong for Netflix, and what can it learn from Hotstar‚Äôs robust infrastructure? This article explores the software architecture, challenges, and lessons learned from the Tyson vs. Paul streaming failure, comparing it with Hotstar‚Äôs success in live streaming. The Streaming Breakdown: Netflix‚Äôs Technical Issues Netflix, the world‚Äôs leading on-demand streaming service, has built an infrastructure optimized for delivering pre-recorded content. Its OpenConnect CDN (Content Delivery Network) is highly efficient for serving video content in a predictable, on-demand manner. However, live streaming events like the Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight are entirely different beasts ‚Äî requiring real-time processing, low latency, and the ability to handle sudden spikes in traffic. Netflix‚Äôs OpenConnect CDN: Optimized for On-Demand, Not Live Events Netflix‚Äôs architecture is designed for on-demand streaming, not high-traffic live broadcasts. Here are the core components of its architecture: - OpenConnect CDN: Netflix uses its own global content delivery network, OpenConnect, to deliver pre-cached video content. The CDN caches videos at local Internet Service Provider (ISP) networks to reduce latency and deliver smooth playback. - Data Centers: Netflix uses distributed data centers around the world. For on-demand video, the company can predict traffic patterns and ensure videos are readily available in the most relevant data centers. However, live events introduce unpredictability. - Video Processing: Netflix pre-processes videos and stores them in various resolutions on OpenConnect servers. This is ideal for on-demand content but not sufficient for live streaming, which demands real-time encoding and adaptive bitrate streaming. The Challenges During Tyson vs. Paul When millions of viewers tried to tune into the Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight, Netflix‚Äôs infrastructure faced several critical issues: - Scalability: Netflix‚Äôs CDN struggled to handle the massive spike in traffic. Unlike on-demand streaming, where content is spread out over time, live events have an immediate and highly concurrent demand. - Latency and Buffering: Netflix‚Äôs on-demand approach, reliant on caching content in advance, led to high latency. Real-time live events require continuous streaming, which involves complex encoding and distribution. - Overloaded Servers: During peak moments, Netflix‚Äôs servers were overloaded and failed to route traffic efficiently. This resulted in 504 Gateway Timeouts and stream buffering, where viewers were left staring at loading screens. - Audio-Video Sync Issues: Live broadcasts require tight synchronization between video and audio, which Netflix‚Äôs infrastructure wasn‚Äôt fully prepared to handle. This led to audio delays and mismatched visuals, further diminishing the experience. Hotstar: A Benchmark for Live Streaming Hotstar, a streaming platform known for broadcasting major events like IPL (Indian Premier League) matches, sets a high standard in handling massive concurrent users. It achieved over 59 million concurrent users during a live cricket match in 2023. Multi-CDN Strategy and Real-Time Adaptability - Multi-CDN Architecture: Unlike Netflix, Hotstar employs a multi-CDN strategy. This means it uses several content delivery networks (such as Akamai, AWS CloudFront, and others) to dynamically distribute live content. This multi-CDN approach helps avoid the bottlenecks caused by a single CDN. - Edge Computing: Hotstar places content delivery closer to the user by using edge servers in various geographic locations. This reduces latency by serving video from a server that is physically closer to the viewer, resulting in faster load times and smoother playback. - Adaptive Bitrate Streaming (ABR): Hotstar uses adaptive bitrate streaming to automatically adjust video quality based on the viewer‚Äôs network conditions. If a user‚Äôs internet connection slows down, the platform adjusts the video quality to avoid buffering, ensuring continuous playback. - Scalability: Hotstar‚Äôs infrastructure is highly scalable, with automatic load balancing and the ability to handle massive traffic spikes, especially during live sports events. The system can dynamically allocate resources and bandwidth as needed. - Real-Time Encoding: Hotstar‚Äôs architecture supports real-time encoding and processing, ensuring that video is delivered as quickly as possible without noticeable delays. Handling High-Concurrency and Live Events Hotstar has successfully managed millions of concurrent viewers during sports events like IPL and international cricket matches. It achieves this by: - Efficiently distributing live video streams across multiple data centers. - Using scalable systems that can allocate more resources as user traffic increases. - Ensuring redundancy and failover systems to prevent server overloads. Comparing the Two Architectures Lessons Netflix Can Learn from Hotstar‚Äôs Success - Adopt a Multi-CDN Strategy: Netflix should integrate a multi-CDN setup to manage high traffic volumes, particularly during live events. This will ensure better load balancing and less reliance on a single CDN. - Real-Time Streaming Infrastructure: Live events require a real-time streaming pipeline with adaptive bitrate and real-time encoding. Netflix should consider integrating a similar approach to ensure smooth delivery of live content. - Edge Computing: Hotstar‚Äôs use of edge computing ensures faster delivery and lower latency. Netflix should implement a similar system to bring content closer to the user, especially during live events where latency is critical. - Scalability and Traffic Management: The ability to scale quickly during unexpected traffic surges is key to handling live events. Netflix should enhance its infrastructure to dynamically allocate resources based on real-time traffic demands. - Redundancy and Failover: Hotstar‚Äôs multi-CDN strategy also provides redundancy in case of failures. Netflix can benefit from implementing failover mechanisms to prevent crashes and improve overall reliability. Conclusion Netflix‚Äôs failure during the Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight highlights the significant differences between streaming on-demand content and live events. While Netflix‚Äôs infrastructure is highly efficient for on-demand streaming, it lacks the real-time capabilities necessary for live broadcasts. Hotstar, on the other hand, has honed its system over the years to handle massive live traffic spikes, providing a smoother, more resilient experience. As Netflix continues to expand into live sports streaming, adopting some of the strategies that Hotstar has perfected will be crucial for maintaining the quality and reliability of its broadcasts. References Hotstar‚Äôs Scaling Success During IPL AWS Case Study on Hotstar Challenges in Handling Concurrent Users Netflix System Design The Verge ‚Äî Netflix Streaming Issues Let me know if you‚Äôd like further refinement or additional comparisons!

author: Brooke Singman
title: NY v. Trump: Tabloid publisher testifies he bought stories on Tiger Woods, ex-Obama chief of staff | Fox News
text: A former tabloid publisher and key witness for the prosecution testified that he purchased stories about professional golfer Tiger Woods, former Obama chief of staff Rahm Emanuel, among others during questioning by defense attorneys for former President Trump. Prosecutors from Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg‚Äôs office brought David Pecker, their first witness, to the stand for the third day Thursday. Pecker is the former CEO of American Media Inc., the parent company of publications such as the National Enquirer, who has known Trump stretching back to the 1980s. Prosecutors allege that Pecker worked closely with the Trump campaign to bury negative information about Trump ahead of the 2016 election. Trump is accused of falsifying records related to the alleged \"catch and kill\" scheme. Pecker testified that he purchased negative stories about Trump before the 2016 election and did not publish them ‚Äî known as a \"catch and kill\" scheme. The stories included allegations from adult film actress Stormy Daniels and Playboy model Karen McDougal about affairs with Trump. NY PROSECUTORS REVEAL 'ANOTHER CRIME' TRUMP ALLEGEDLY TRIED TO CONCEAL WITH FALSIFIED BUSINESS RECORDS With regard to negative stories coming out about Trump before the election, Pecker testified that Trump was concerned about what his family would say about it, specifically about how it would impact his wife Melania Trump and daughter Ivanka Trump. Pecker also testified that Trump was concerned about what the impact would be on his campaign in 2016. But under cross-examination by Trump defense attorney Emil Bove, Pecker testified he purchased stories about other high-profile individuals besides Trump. Pecker testified he purchased a story about professional golfer Tiger Woods, and a story about Rahm Emanuel in 2009 after he left the Obama White House. Pecker said he purchased the story about an alleged affair Emanuel had so that it would not be published. Emanuel also later served as ambassador to Japan. TRUMP TRIAL: FORMER PRESIDENT 'INNOCENT,' DEFENSE SAYS AS DA ALLEGES 'CRIMINAL CONSPIRACY' Pecker also testified that he worked with Trump attorney Michael Cohen in his capacity as the former president‚Äôs personal attorney ‚Äî not as part of the 2016 campaign. Pecker testified that American Media Inc., the owner of the National Enquirer, testified that before purchasing stories, the company would vet them for truthfulness. He also testified that there were instances AMI would purchase a story to use as leverage. When asked if this was standard, Pecker testified: \"Yes.\" Pecker also said Thursday that Trump \"was my mentor.\" \"He helped me throughout my career,\" Pecker said, saying Trump was often the first person to call him when he needed help. \"Even though we haven‚Äôt spoken, I still considered him a friend,\" Pecker said. Bragg charged Trump with 34 counts of falsifying business records in the first degree. Bragg alleges that Trump ex-attorney Michael Cohen orchestrated hush money payments to Stormy Daniels and Karen McDougal to prevent them from sharing their stories about alleged affairs with Trump. Bragg is trying to prove that Trump was aware of those payments, and allegedly falsified records of payments to Cohen as \"legal expenses\" rather than repayments for the hush money. NY VS TRUMP: THE EVIDENCE PROSECUTORS CAN PRESENT IF FORMER PRESIDENT TESTIFIES Trump has pleaded not guilty to all counts and told Fox News Digital in an exclusive interview on Thursday that he was simply paying Cohen legal fees because Cohen was his lawyer. Bragg also alleged American Media Inc., which Pecker was the CEO of, allegedly employed the \"catch and kill\" strategy to bury stories ‚Äî specifically Karen McDougal's. Bragg and prosecutors sought to convince the jury that Pecker's work to do this was made with the blessing of Trump's 2016 campaign. CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP Pecker, though, testified that he worked with Cohen in his capacity as Trump's personal attorney. Pecker's cross-examination is expected to continue Friday morning.

author: VNExplorer
title: "Perdidos en el Amazonas": la historia de tres ni√±os y un beb√©, que sobrevivieron 40 d√≠as en la naturaleza
text: Era el 1 de mayo de 2023 cuando se registr√≥ el accidente, pero fue hasta d√≠as despu√©s que las autoridades dieron con el automotor. Foto: Max Le llamaron Operaci√≥n Esperanza porque no hab√≠a otra manera de seguir adelante. Cuatro ni√±os de 13, 9 y 4 a√±os de edad, m√°s un beb√© de 11 meses, hab√≠an sido pasajeros de un avi√≥n ca√≠do en la selva colombiana, pero no se ten√≠a rastro de ellos. Era el 1 de mayo de 2023 cuando se registr√≥ el accidente, pero fue hasta d√≠as despu√©s que las autoridades dieron con el automotor y encontrando √∫nicamente los cuerpos de los tres adultos que los acompa√±aban, inclu√≠da su madre. Se movilizaron m√°s de 200 personas entre el ej√©rcito cafetalero y la guardia ind√≠gena a fin de dar con el paradero de los peque√±os, transcurriendo 39 d√≠as sin rastro de ellos. Lo que pas√≥ se cuenta en el documental ‚ÄúPerdidos en el Amazonas‚Äù, reci√©n lanzado en la plataforma streaming MAX, confeccionado expresamente con videos encontrados y proporcionados por testigos de la traves√≠a. ‚ÄúSe convirti√≥ en una historia universal pr√°cticamente desde el principio, pero sobre todo a partir del momento en el que se encuentra la avioneta y descubren que esos cuatro ni√±os no est√°n, teniendo entonces la simple posibilidad de que pudieran estar vivos‚Äù, comenta Cristina Nieto, co directora espa√±ola del filme. La pel√≠cula se ve enriquecida con entrevistas al t√≠o de los ni√±os, al due√±o de la aeronave y los militares que participaron en la b√∫squeda. Todos los materiales que se ven son los originales levantados durante la traves√≠a, la √∫nica intervenci√≥n que se les hizo fue ponerlos en blanco y negro. ‚ÄúNicol√°s, por ejemplo, que es uno de los buscadores ind√≠genas, nos regal√≥ el momento en que los encontraron. Todo est√° contado en primera persona, no hay una sola voz narrando todo. Lo que t√∫ escuchas que dice Nicol√°s cuando los encuentran, es real, todo ese sonido, el canto que hace, son momentos que pasaron ese d√≠a‚Äù, destaca Jaime Escall√≥n, guionista y co director. ‚ÄúEl blanco y negro nos ayudaba a puntualizar y a dramatizar determinados hechos y era una apuesta arriesgada porque no se utiliza mucho ahora. Pero era para ver la memoria, nosotros tenemos mucho de nuestro pasado en blanco y negro, no a colores y adem√°s nos permit√≠a hacia el final del documental, entrar a un mundo imaginario‚Äù, ataja Clara. Para la elaboraci√≥n de ‚ÄúPerdidos en el Amazonas‚Äù se cont√≥ con la colaboraci√≥n de Jos√© Alejandro Casta√±o, periodista cercano a lo ocurrido y parte de la unidad investigativa del documental. ‚ÄúSoy colombiano y he contado historias sobre selvas y bosques amaz√≥nicos, pero de repente por circunstancias extraordinarias, termin√© acompa√±ando la misi√≥n militar en la b√∫squeda de los ni√±os, con todo ese ej√©rcito humanitario que se configur√≥ a partir de la de los ind√≠genas y que no es algo habitual‚Äù, relata el comunicador. ‚ÄúSe hab√≠an destinado 120 comandos de la m√°xima graduaci√≥n y estaban unos 78- 80 ind√≠genas y casi a los 40 d√≠as estaba claro que ya no iban a continuar la b√∫squeda y si encontraban algo ser√≠an sus cad√°veres. Fue cuando se decidi√≥ hacer un √∫ltimo esfuerzo‚Äù, a√±ade. El 9 de junio, 40 d√≠as despu√©s del accidente a√©reo, los ni√±os fueron hallados con signos de desnutrici√≥n y trauma, pero vivos. En su camino hab√≠an sido encontrados ramas y palos tirados, un biber√≥n, una fruta medio comer, que daban precisamente la esperanza de una conclusi√≥n positiva. rad
